cyclone.name: OLGA
cyclone.current_location: about 320 miles SSW of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north then turning north-northeast across the north-western Gulf toward the central Louisiana coast and Lower Mississippi Valley

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and eastern Louisiana to coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Outer rain-bands may bring brief gusts, but sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (<20% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the upper Texas coast; surge risk confined east of the Mississippi River Delta.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could bring 1â€“2 inches of rain; flash-flood threat remains east of the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated squalls and elevated seas may briefly affect vessel traffic Friday afternoon and evening.
